column4: you can hack up nfs failover with linux nfs, just bring up an identical export on the same IP and if it's hard mounted the clients just remount and continue ;)
just my point really - that's because of the NFS protocol itself - not the specific implementation
ubuntu doesn't include new releases in a stable version, just security and bug fixes. there will probably be a newer versrion in dapper though :)
just compiled with the kqemu kernel module (proprietary unfortunately) it's a much quicker install so far
